items.name: Component_FrameAnimation
items.content: # =================================================================== # # Script: Component_FrameAnimation # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== # FIXME: This class still follows deprecated rules, should be fixed. class Component_FrameAnimation extends gs.Component_Animation ###* * Executes a classic image-frame animation defined in Database. The image in regular * contains multiple sub-images (frames) which are then animated * by modifying the srcRect property of the game object. * * @module gs * @class Component_FrameAnimation * @extends gs.Component_Animation * @memberof gs * @constructor * @param {Object} record - The animation database-record. ### constructor: (record) -> super ###* * The database record. * @property record * @type Object ### @record = null ###* * The name of the animation defined in Database. * @property name * @type string ### @name = null ###* * The amount of frames on x-axis. * @property framesX * @type number ### @framesX = 1 ###* * The amount of frames on y-axis. * @property framesY * @type number ### @framesY = 1 ###* * The frame-range to animation like only Frame 4 - 6 for example. * @property frameRange * @type gs.Range ### @frameRange = { start: 0, end: 0 } ###* * The frame-range used if the animation gets repeated. * @property repetitionFrameRange * @type gs.Range ### @repetitionFrameRange = @frameRange ###* * The amount of frames to animate. * @property frameCount * @type number * @protected ### @frameCount = 1 ###* * The graphic used as image for the animation. * @property graphic * @type Object ### @graphic = null ###* * Indicates if the animation repeats. * @property repeat * @type boolean ### @repeat = no ###* * The position of the animation on the target-object. * @property framesY * @type gs.AnimationPosition ### @position = 0 ###* * The duration of a single frame. * @property frameDuration * @type number * @protected ### @frameDuration = 10 ###* * A frame-counter needed for animation-process. * @property frameDuration * @type number * @protected ### @frameCounter = 0 ###* * The duration of the animation. * @property frameDuration * @type number ### @duration = 10 ###* * Indicates if the animation is currently running. * @property isRunning * @type boolean ### @isRunning = no ###* * Stores frame/pattern-offset. * @property patternOffset * @type number * @protected ### @patternOffset = @frameRange.start ###* * Stores current frame/pattern * @property patternOffset * @type number * @protected ### @pattern = @patternOffset ###* * Indicates if its still the first run of the animation. * @property firstRun * @type boolean * @protected ### @firstRun = yes if record? @refresh(record) @start() ###* * Serializes the frame-animation into a data-bundle. * * @method toDataBundle ### toDataBundle: -> name: @name, framesX: @framesX, framesY: @framesY, frameRange: @frameRange, repetitionFrameRange: @repetitionFrameRange, frameCount: @frameCount, graphic: @graphic, repeat: @repeat, position: @position, frameDuration: @frameDuration, frameCounter: @frameCounter, duration: @duration, isRunning: @isRunning, patternOffset: @patternOffset, pattern: @pattern, firstRun: @firstRun ###* * Refreshes the animation from the specified database-record. * * @method refresh * @param {Object} record - The animation database-record. ### # FIXME: Is that method still in use? refresh: (record) -> ###* * The images to animate through. * @property images * @type string[] ### @name = record.name @framesX = record.framesX || 1 @framesY = record.framesY || 1 @frameRange = { start: Math.min(record.frameRange.start, record.frameRange.end), end: Math.max(record.frameRange.start, record.frameRange.end) } @repetitionFrameRange = if record.useRepetitionFrameRange and record.repetitionFrameRange? then record.repetitionFrameRange else @frameRange @frameCount = (@frameRange.end - @frameRange.start) + 1 @graphic = record.graphic @repeat = record.repeat || no @position = record.position @frameDuration = if record.duration? then Math.round(record.duration / @frameCount) else 10 @frameCounter = 0 @duration = record.duration || 10 @isRunning = no @patternOffset = @frameRange.start @pattern = @patternOffset @firstRun = yes ###* * Starts the frame-animation. * * @method start ### start: (callback) -> @callback = callback @isRunning = yes @firstRun = yes @frameCounter = 0 @frameCount = (@frameRange.end - @frameRange.start) + 1 @frameDuration = Math.round(@duration / @frameCount) @patternOffset = @frameRange.start - 1 ###* * Updates the frame-animation. * * @method update ### update: -> super if not @isRunning then return if @frameCounter >= @duration if @repeat @firstRun = no @frameCounter = 0 @frameCount = (@repetitionFrameRange.end - @repetitionFrameRange.start) + 1 @frameDuration = Math.ceil(@duration / @frameCount) @patternOffset = @repetitionFrameRange.start - 1 else @isRunning = no @onFinish?(this) @callback?(@object, this) return @pattern = @patternOffset + Math.floor(@frameCounter / @frameDuration) @frameCounter++ if @object? bitmap = @object.bitmap || ResourceManager.getBitmap("#{@object.imageFolder||"Graphics/Pictures"}/#{@object.image}") if bitmap? frameWidth = Math.floor(bitmap.width / @framesX) frameHeight = Math.floor(bitmap.height / @framesY) column = @pattern % @framesX row = Math.floor(@pattern / @framesX) @object.srcRect.set(column * frameWidth, row * frameHeight, frameWidth, frameHeight) @object.dstRect.width = @object.srcRect.width @object.dstRect.height = @object.srcRect.height window.Component_FrameAnimation = Component_FrameAnimation gs.Component_FrameAnimation = Component_FrameAnimation
